intro: Pycreus capillaris var. nilagiricus, commonly known as the Nilagiri pycreus, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
